page.title: 04HOW TWO BURNS WERE NAMED
page.content: (N.B. Burn= Stream) In 1294 a battle took place which gave two burns their names.The battle was between the MacDougalls of Lorn and the Campbells of Loch Awe whose leader was Cailean Mor.(That means Big Colin)They met(or were meant to)at a burn called the Conference Burn .It got its name because they were going to have a conference there.That same burn was the border of their lands,but before they met the MacDougalls look in their crystal ball to see what would happen and the crystal ball broke.This made them late for the meeting.When the Campbells went to the meeting place,the MacDougalls were not there so the Campbells went onto the MacDougalls ground and that is went a big battle started. (Continued on page 5).
